summary: Capital One's response to a grand jury subpoena (Case No. 2019R00903) dated August 28, 2019, regarding the Epstein investigation. The document includes a cover letter with objections and a declaration certifying the authenticity of business records provided in response to the subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued in the matter of 2019R00903, directed to Capital One Bank N.A.

events.title: Capital One Subpoena Response
events.description: Capital One responded to the grand jury subpoena with documents and information, along with objections to the subpoena's scope and service.

keyFacts: Capital One received a grand jury subpoena (Case No. 2019R00903) dated August 28, 2019, related to the Epstein investigation.

Capital One responded with documents but raised multiple objections, including that the subpoena might be directed to an incorrect legal entity and that the request could be overbroad or unduly burdensome.
The response includes a declaration certifying the authenticity of business records under Federal Rules of Evidence 803(6) and 902(11).
The document indicates a grand jury investigation was active in August 2019, following Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
Capital One explicitly states it cannot guarantee its production contains 'all documents' for any specific customer or account.
